activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica L. Foreman

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jessica L. Foreman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by audio visual zoomvideo for Jessica L. Foreman.  Atty Burns statement. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Atty Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Atty Burns willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Atty Burns statement to court - an agreement reached and would like to discuss bond.  Atty Schiek no objections to modifying to a $500.00 cash bond with same conditions.  - Bond continued. adj. 11:36 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Must reside with mother Insuk Foreman in Gleason, WI/No contact with R.R.

1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jessica L. Foreman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Jessica L. Foreman. Mary has just been appointed - has not spoken to Defendant yet - would like to address bond. Roth/Schiek statement to bond. Defendant states she works at home doing nails - would reside with mother if released. Court lowers cash bond with conditions. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. adj. 01:31 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jessica L. Foreman appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on employment. Defendant statement to charges/bond. Court sets bond. adj. 01:37 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
